title: Venezuela expels U.N. human rights officers, citing ‘colonialist’ behavior
description: The move was a sharp escalation of tensions with the international community following the arrest of a prominent human rights activist in the country.

title: Khaled Nezzar, who led Algeria’s crackdowns on Islamists, dies at 86
description: Last year, Swiss prosecutors indicted Gen. Nezzar for crimes against humanity for Algeria’s “Black Decade” of repression in the 1990s.

title: Putin calls Biden ‘predictable’ in latest faint praise for a U.S. leader
description: The Russian leader suggested that he would prefer Biden over Trump, but Putin has often trolled his American counterparts.

title: No good options for Israel as it prepares for assault on Rafah
description: President Biden has said the United States will not support a full-scale attack on Rafah unless Israel can carry out a “credible plan” to evacuate civilians.

title: Ukraine on verge of losing Avdiivka, strategic city long targeted by Russia
description: As the Russians advance, the question of whether to continue defending the city poses a first test for Oleksandr Syrsky, Ukraine’s new commander in chief.

title: What is the Radwan force, Hezbollah’s elite unit on the Israeli border?
description: The unit, created to launch offensive attacks including forays into Israel, is believed to have been engaged in the fighting across the Lebanon-Israel border since Oct. 7.

title: The River Thames is a London landmark. Police keep pulling out bodies.
description: Dozens of bodies are found each year in the River Thames which runs through London. Police retrieved two while searching for chemical attack suspect Abdul Ezedi.

title: India’s top court bans anonymous election donations in blow to ruling party
description: The decision brings opaque campaign financing, an issue bedeviling democracies worldwide, to the forefront in India, where election costs have ballooned.

title: Young Chinese, fed up with family pressure, opt out of Lunar New Year
description: The Lunar New Year period is a time of heavy family responsibility: Traveling back home, handing out cash in red envelopes, spending endless days with the family. Some are opting out.

title: Middle East conflict live updates: Israel escalates strikes on Lebanon; more world leaders warn against Rafah assault
description: The leaders of Canada, Australia and New Zealand said they were gravely concerned about Israel’s intentions for a ground offensive in the Gazan city of Rafah.

title: These babies were rescued from Gaza. What future awaits them?
description: Most of the premature babies evacuated from al-Shifa hospital in Gaza are now in Egypt. While some are with their parents, others appear to be alone in the world.

title: Ukraine and its allies face off against America’s tribal politics
description: Ukraine and its allies are left watching Washington’s political dysfunction, again.

title: Anthony Epstein, pathologist behind Epstein-Barr virus find, dies at 102
description: The breakthrough in the 1960s opened the way for studies into viral links to human cancers.

title: U.S., Arab nations plan for postwar Gaza, timeline for Palestinian state
description: Initial cease-fire for the release of hostages is seen as key to providing space to introduce a new peace deal.
